Summary I am an outgoing, enthusiastic, team-oriented person who believes that no dream is beyond realization. I hope to work in a team setting where learning from one another is facilitated through problem-solving and collaborative critical thought. It is my conviction that when people work together towards a common goal, we are truly capable of anything. I take great pride in my work ethic, and am a humble yet confident leader in most group settings. Thank you for your consideration and your attention! View Senior Program Staff Pambamarca Archaeology Project June 2012  –  August 2012  (3 months) Cangahua, Ecuador Assisted Drs. Samuel Connell (Foothill College/UCLA) and Chad Gifford (Columbia University) in fieldwork investigating pre-Columbian fortresses in the Ecuadorian Andes. Duties included: 
 
Plan day-to-day project activities, design research agendas. 
 
Manage excavations, teach students methodological, scientific, and technical aspects of archaeology. 
 
Identification, cleaning and processing of artifacts. 
 
••Teach students ethnographic methods, aiding in their real-life application of skills such as participant-observation, interviews and ethnoarchaeological theory. 
 
••Collaborate with community leaders and program directors to create educational experiences for students that also benefit the people of our host town, such as assessing the potential benefits of constructing an traditional indigenous health center in Cangahua. Assist in report-writing and document preparation in order to present findings. Summary ● Designed, developed, and implemented end to end technology solution from the ground up to translate startup founder’s vision for a revenue-generating stock trading system into functional reality. 
● Developed nine predictive analytics campaign models; resulting average campaign lift 93% 
● Developed two time series forecast models; resulting average 59% improvement in forecast accuracy

Summary I’m an EDI Systems Analyst in the Distribution Product group for Expeditors International, a leading international third party logistics firm. In this role I manage translation projects from beginning to end to meet the requirements of growing business. Our most exciting work to date was working to implement complex EDI translation projects for firms with substantial shipping requirements. Not only did we have fun working through the challenges associated with the process, but we also found a sense of accomplishment in observing our completed project. 
 
Before joining Expeditors International, I worked contract-to-contract at Starbucks corporate - and was lucky enough to participate in the roll-out of a nationwide labor forecasting system, in addition to many other rewarding experiences. 
 
I’m truly passionate about my work and always eager to connect with like-minded peers. While I enjoy all aspects of my job, I think my favorite stage of a project is working with a business unit leader to understand his or her business objectives. As we go through that collaborative process, the creative problem-solving thoughts begin to flow, which is definitely a highlight of the job. 
 
I earned a BS in Applied Math and Computational Science (ACMS) from the University of Washington in Seattle. 
 
I’m always interested in hearing from former colleagues, managers, or just interesting creative folk, so feel free to contact me if you’d like to connect.
